appearances.snippet: darrell issa. >> i thank you. a lot can be said about my friend and colleague, my western caucus chair, but today was a special day for us. we had lunch today as california members, and doug paid for it because every week somebody sponsors it. and his death was so sudden that it literally had been prepaid. and it arrived. and we sat there thinking of the person who had the best joke every week, who had a constant, positive, positive sense of humor, even about dire times talked about not long ago, about how much he got done during the shutdown. and you know, what it was like to actually meet with his constituents multiple days in a row, day after day. that was doug lamalfa, a farmer, a family man, but most importantly, somebody that could always find the positive and the funny about whatever we were doing. we're a body of 431 right now. at our best, we're a body of 435, but it's the one that we're missing that can make a difference. and that was doug. he will be missed for a very long time by all of us. and for tha
